body:
> Hi @strongduanmu , there is an error and I don’t know how to solve it. I am wondering whether to modify a small configuration problem in pom.xml.

@zzs52 It seems that it is caused by the environment. I will re-trigger ci.

> > Hi @strongduanmu , there is an error and I don’t know how to solve it. I am wondering whether to modify a small configuration problem in pom.xml.
> 
> @zzs52 It seems that it is caused by the environment. I will re-trigger ci.

Ok,thanks.
Probably not. This is just to traverse the rewritten SQL. Even if you have hundreds of fragmented tables, it is only 0(N), which is negligible for the current server.

> Hi @roodkcab, we have provide [sql hint](https://shardingsphere.apache.org/document/current/cn/user-manual/shardingsphere-jdbc/special-api/sharding/hint/#%E4%BD%BF%E7%94%A8-hint-%E8%B7%AF%E7%94%B1%E8%87%B3%E6%8C%87%E5%AE%9A%E6%95%B0%E6%8D%AE%E5%BA%93) in the master branch, I think you can try it. SQL hint can implement primary dataSource routing through comments in sql.
> 
> ```sql
> /* ShardingSphere hint: writeRouteOnly=true */
> SELECT * FROM t_order;
> ```

yes, I know. and we have distsql to change session based hint too. the need is to use hint by dsn, i.e. use host, port or username to set hint automatically.

> This feature is for readwrite split, could we consider enclosure it into readwrite-splitting module?

then I guess we have to encapsulate session information into sql context ?

> Can you try it?

Yes! it throw a Exception like this "Cause: java.sql.SQLException: No value specified for parameter";
Hi @Huletian, thank you for your feedback, I will track this issue.
@xcmonline Hello, Can you tell me your ShardingSphere-Proxy version?

@userkdg Can you give the sql from you app to proxy? now, from the stack info, maybe your app start a transaction with `read only` and then run a `insert` statement, then the exception exported is expected.

          shardingAlgorithmName: sharding_by_time
      keyGenerateStrategy:
        column: id
        keyGeneratorName: snowflake
  defaultDatabaseStrategy:
    none:
  defaultTableStrategy:
    none:
  shardingAlgorithms:
    sharding_by_time:
      type: auto_interval
      props:
        datetime-lower: "2020-10-01 00:00:00"
        sharding-seconds: "86400"
        datetime-upper: "2020-10-05 00:00:00"
  keyGenerators:
    snowflake:
      type: SNOWFLAKE
      props:
        worker-id: 123
